nodes.title: 07/19/23 Weekly Meeting 116 Notes/Agenda
nodes.body: Weekly Meeting 116 is happening on Wednesday, July 19, 2023 from 9:00 AM PST (16:00 UTC) - 10:00 AM PST (17:00 UTC) You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t). We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR/OMI Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E). We regularly use the # omi-meeting-chat channel for text chat. ## Who we are and why we're here: The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal. If youâ€™re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help! We welcome you to introduce yourself in #omi-meeting-chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals. ## Agenda - notes from last week: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/406 - champions two weeks ago: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/404 - new readme: https://github.com/omigroup/ - MSF POG status - we are approved and finished with the application. - now its time to nominate to the board (I believe, can we confirm?) - Open Collective Update - - re: payments. I need help. - Jin submitted a prop https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/400, we ready? - https://twitter.com/boomboxheads/status/1678872345849794560?s=20 boombox grant? how can we help people like this with exactly this sort of thing? ### UPDATES: - vket - copilot - MSF delegates - Media group - Avatar interop group - GLTF group - World Hops

## How can we raise awareness for OMI activities and what is possible? 

Thoughts?

## Media 
- we have an opp for a AI newsletter tool, if we are interested in using/testing contact Evo!

## glTF 
- re: microsoft, at an impasse on some critical issues. may result in competing standards. Need to see more people showing up in the comments. At the moment it is mostly 2-3 people discussing and that should be like 10 to be more effective.

# We can talk about ourselves 
- how can we dogfood our protocols in our own work? 
- how can we give access to our community to our tools and companies products to experiment further with OMI protocols? 
  - ex. I can give alpha access to magickml.com for anyone who wants to try to experiment with Magick agents and OMI_Personality. 
  - ex. maybe we can encourage builders like null to try to implement OMI protocols in their worlds and VRMs

# Conferences are boring - lets have a parade! 
- people can make floats! 
  - maybe the floats use OMI_seat 
- floats can be parked and turned into booths!
- anyone can create a float for the event 
- we can host the parade in multiple platforms 
- a pure celebration of todays interoperability 
- portal jumping across parade floats ðŸ˜‚

## future standards 
Do we have an OMI_wheel spec? or additional standards for vehicles? 
- yes, we have drafts

# NEXT WEEK 
continue planning next week 
create a page for our website to refer people to about the parade(s)

nodes.title: 07/12/23 Weekly Meeting 115 Notes/Agenda
nodes.body: Weekly Meeting 115 is happening on Wednesday, July 12, 2023 from 9:00 AM PST (16:00 UTC) - 10:00 AM PST (17:00 UTC) You can add it to your calendar [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/1?cid=Y18wZHB1Z2Y5ZjgzZXE0cWVrbWI2b21xYmptZ0Bncm91cC5jYWxlbmRhci5nb29nbGUuY29t). We'll be meeting again in the omi-weekly-meeting channel of the [AngellXR/OMI Discord](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E). We regularly use the # omi-meeting-chat channel for text chat. ## Who we are and why we're here: The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group (OMI) is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal. If youâ€™re an observer or here for the first time, this is a meeting where people who work on the OMI group initiatives discuss updates and contribution opportunities for current projects and goals. This is your chance to jump in and help! We welcome you to introduce yourself in #omi-meeting-chat as we dive into the agenda items. There will be an open floor in the last 15 minutes of the meeting (agenda permitting) where we can discuss any items you feel are relevant to the current or near future OMI goals. ## Agenda - notes from last week: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/402 - champions last week: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/discussions/404 - new readme: https://github.com/omigroup/ - MSF POG status - we are approved and finished with the application. - now its time to nominate to the board (I believe, can we confirm?) - Open Collective Update - - re: payments. I need help. - Jin submitted a prop https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/400, we ready? - https://twitter.com/boomboxheads/status/1678872345849794560?s=20 boombox grant? how can we help people like this with exactly this sort of thing? ### UPDATES: - MSF delegates - Media group - Avatar interop group - GLTF group - World Hops

RE: Github Copilot Business Accounts for Dedicated OMI Volunteers 
- we are voting on approving up to 2 licenses for the tool 
- if we need more in the future, we will re-vote and reflect on the prior use of the tool.
- the cost is $19/mo. per license 
- we will define a SOP for the licenses (aka, if we need to transfer a license to a different user in the future) 
- we will vote in OMI-Votes on discord

# OMI grants (future) 
- Boomboxheads[ recently tweeted an ask about grants](https://twitter.com/boomboxheads/status/1678872345849794560?s=20) available for interoperability/unity based projects. 
- How can we help people like this?  
- ![image](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/assets/63426722/a0a8ebed-ba2e-44a8-bcee-f807327e252a)

# updates - aaron is making a new exporter that lets you add additional information and choose your protocols when exporting gltf settings! Like an interoperable manifest of sorts! (inspired by the blender export settings window) - jin made a OMI world! - - it has pixel too! (same as our website) - - collaborative whiteboards! - - Portals! - embedded site!

nodes.title: OMI Champions Sync July 7, 2023
nodes.body:
# Review landing page

See catus comments.

# OMIGroup README rewriting with GPT4

# MSF POG approved

Next steps included. 
![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/HkVeIkUt3.png)

MSF Standards Register <haudiobe.ts@googlemail.com>
Tue, Jun 27, 6:45â€¯AM (10 days ago)
to jesse, robert, evo, cperey, humbletim, me, tsto, tse

Dear colleagues,

Thanks for submitting the POG information.

We have accepted "Metaverse Interoperability Community Group (Open Metaverse Interoperability Group, OMI)" as a MSF PoG according to our procedures [here](https://metaverse-standards.org/domain-groups/standards-register/call-for-metaverse-related-standards-setting-and-community-organizations/) .

The list of approved POGs is published on our web site and will gradually be updated over time.
We will also offer the ability to change information of your POG, an advanced register system is under development.

Meanwhile, to initiate the submission of Standards-related Publications and Projects (SPPs), we have created an online spreadsheet for each approved POG, yours is here. Write access is restricted to your Designated Representatives in to. This is a temporary solution and a more user friendly and advanced system is currently under development. However, we would like to invite you to fill in selected SPPs with all the requested metadata. We will then review the data, and if appropriate and complete, add this to our database and soon also publish on our web site.

Should you have any issue on the submission, or comments on the form, feel free to respond to this e-mail or add comments to the git issue here.

Best regards,

The MSF Register Working Group

https://register.metaverse-standards.org/

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1kgM-V1hTzSytjnd64DDiXvVsXYZs9f175cYZ6vRaaPk/edit#gid=1171833320

https://github.com/MetaverseStandards/Metaverse-Standards-Register/issues/66

## Request for MSF Metadata review. Need sample.

Please review and return feedback 

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/B11kPyLt2.png)


# Open Collective 

https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/376

BLOCKED 

- we were told to create a new second account under c3, and the funds could be transferred 
- we created a second OC account under the new c3 fiscal sponsorship request. 
- now they would like us to close the first account by "zeroing the account"
    - we are not comfortable zeroing the account, those funds would need to be held in escrow, or transferred directly from the old to the new as initially stated. 
- for this reason we would fall under the "not ready to leave OSCs hosting unitl you are sure you will be approved by OCF" bucket, and they provided steps: 
    - answer this question: why do we want to transition from c6 to c3? 
        - we want to be able to apply for grants 
        - we consist of and represent a public collective of open source collaborators. 
        - action: what else, why else do we want to transition? 
    - review OCFs Eligibility Requirements and these important reminders 
        - answer: we don't want to shut down the old one until the new one is running. We would like our little funds transferred to the new account without complication. 
        - action: please review those again. Are we certain? Why are we eligible? 

## Monthly Receipts 

- I need help submitting every month, it takes very little time, but it is a task that requires some consistency and discipline. 
- we agreed to switch to yearly payments, so its possible this becomes and even lighter lift. 
- we often wait until our cards are cancelled to finally submit our receipts. 
    - Fire has volunteered to help 


## New landing page? 

As described [on issue 403](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/403)
>Let's make it even simpler and decouple the individual working groups from the main readme. Like who are we really, what do we really do, and how can you really get involved?


-----
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>





# Introduction

The Open Metaverse Interoperability Group is focused on bridging virtual worlds by designing and promoting protocols for identity, social graphs, inventory, and more. Our members include businesses and individuals working towards this common goal. OMI aims to create a community of artists, creators, developers, and other innovators to discuss and explore concepts surrounding the design and development of virtual worlds.

The easiest way to try OMI protocols, is to check out our [glTF extensions](https://github.com/omigroup/gltf-extensions#omi-gltf-vendor-extensions). You can see protocols like ours in-action, on [our website](https://omigroup.org) (scroll to the bottom and click `enter world`!) We are always seeking implementers and [collaborators](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup#active-subgroups). 

Interested? We would love if you [get involved with our community](https://discord.gg/NJtT9grz5E) or [otherwise contributed](https://opencollective.com/omigroup). We hope to see you within our [working groups](https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup#active-subgroups). Bring a friend!



</br>
</br>
</br>
</br>


Continued here: https://github.com/omigroup/omigroup/issues/403
